a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: People underestimate others' willingness to take climate action
Participants were asked if they would contribute 1% of their income to tackle climate change. The share that
answered "yes" is shown on the horizontal axis. The share of the population in their country that people think
would be willing is shown on the vertical axis.
Data source: Andre et al. (2024). Globally representative evidence on the actual and perceived support for climate action.
Note: Based on representative surveys of almost 130,000 people across 125 countries.
